intro: Stracheya tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan stracheya, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
